PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: As more TPD was introduced into the polymer backbone , the domain spacing of P1 , P3 , P4 , P5 , and P7 gradually increased from 19.2 , 20.1 , 21.9 , 22.7 to 24.1 Å , respectively.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Property Value" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| TPD introduced into the polymer backbone |
| domain spacing of P1 |
| domain spacing of P3 |
| domain spacing of P4 |
| domain spacing of P5 |
| domain spacing of P7 |
| Property Value |

The entities in the paragraph are:

* TPD (Thermal Pressure Diffusion)
* domain spacing of P1, P3, P4, P5, and P7 (the values of the domain spacing for each of these proteins)

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to "Value of material property", presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 19.2 Å |
| 20.1 Å |
| 21.9 Å |
| 22.7 Å |
| 24.1 Å |

The entities in the paragraph that refer to the value of a material property are:

* TPD (Thermal Pressure Diffusion) is not a material property value, but rather a process that affects the material properties.
* P1, P3, P4, P5, and P7 are protein names, and their domain spacing values are provided in the paragraph as material property values.
